summary: During a fateful night, a group of impossibly attractive 20-somethings (Matt Lanter, Vanessa Minnillo, Kim Kardashian) must dodge a series of man-made and natural disasters. Twisters, asteroids, earthquakes and singer Amy Winehouse are just some of the perils they face while trying to make their way to safety.

reviews.content: WORST MOVIE EVER WHO EVER SAID THIS MOVIE WAS FRESH THERE BELONG IN AN ASYLUM
If i could give this movie zero stars i would. I love parody movies and laugh at just about anything. I couldnt finish it, because it was so awful.

A good comedy writer recognizes the difference between what's funny & what's insultingly humorless. This one did not. Like shooting buckshot from 100 yards, it's a surprise if anything hit the target.
10 minutes in and couldn't take it anymore!
It was awful not even good awful bad acting and very unfunny jokes. I really don't recommend. The worst movie I've ever watched.

Some people call it diaster movie, i call it masterpiece sexy movie. As a beat up forty year old grown ass man, I believe that this kind of film is pretty important 'cause is beyond important to laugh at racist jokes, especially, gross ones, HAHAHAHA, i can't stop laughing as I write this. By the way, the blonde girl in the movie is preety beautiful, is she single? Because i want to take her on a date to hooters, please call me. I'm miserable!
This movie was just like the title says an absolute disaster. How often do you see a movie title point out the movie correctly.

I fucking hated this film, here's why.

First of all, it's one of those movies that goes back to the beginning of the story, before the movie really started and all the major players were introduced.

There was no real tension or drive to keep watching, other than maybe the thrill of finally seeing "the Turtles" for the first time.

That's not enough, especially since it's not some new creature that we've never seen before.

It's a mass produced brand that we've already had so much exposure to.

The second thing that makes this movie so dull is the lack of anything recognizable.

The special effects look kind of cheesy and amateur, and it makes the plot so much more predictable and dull.

There's also the fact that the movie is almost 100% dialogue.

The disaster movie did however do well in its own country, grossing over $150,000,000. The best thing about it was the memes, with users poking fun at the whole thing, This film was dreadful, but I liked it because it was so much like so many of the other films in my genre.

It was probably not even bad, it's just so close to the ones I love.

Horrendous is one way to describe it everything was bad from the jokes to the production to the acting to everything nothing works and seltzer and friedberg can't direct this movie is at the bottom of the barrel 0/10
Well, at least they admitted it...
It's a 10 out of 10 movie I was entertained through the entire movie it even has Dr Phill pleas ignore that bad rating and watch this movie
The song at the end is quite fun, but the movie is so random and full of pointless cameos from different franchises that it sacrifices any sense of story or character.

Omg this movie is just hilariously bad. There is literally a scene where "justin timberlake" is singing at a house party and "the high school musical" people are there and "Zac Efron" LITERALLY and im not kidding throws underwear at Justin Timberlake and he catches it and it has a crap stain on it and he goes "ugh!" And sticks his tongue out

The great thing about this film is that it has gags - a lousy high school musical, a chipmunk eating a spine, Hannah Montana being crushed by a meteorite - and the director's mind can only think of the gags. Excellent. Let me give it 1 star out of respect.
see this now , 😌😌😌😌😌😌😌

Awful....Nothing But Shock Humor, references for the sake of references and terrible set design. One of the Worst Comedies I have ever seen. It's shocking how unfunny it is. Didn't laugh once. This is humor that a 13 year thinks is funny but when they turn 24 they look back and chill at how cringe it is. No Plot at All, terrible acting and horrible editing and cinematography is uninspired. Would give a 0 out of 5 if I could it was that bad. Couldn't wait for this to end.
LOL, the funniest 1.5 hours ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
My husband liked this movie. I assume it was only because of Kim. Jerry, if your reading this, please come back. The PDA is lying to us!

but its incredibly funny when watching with friends

it lives up to its name i remember thinking this movie was amazing it was funny it had  that panda guy and Alvin in the chipmunks but bro this movies sucks looking at it now it makes me wanna throw up looking at it like a pile of old VHS tapes that are discolored and stink this movie had no meaning and i wish it was a Mandela affect and would just disappear
I mean it wasn’t really that bad I saw it yesterday but there was some parts that were “disturbing” and despite the poor/good CGI and animation
LOL, so funny and original!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
quandale dingle berry Jamal started to get mad at the movie and cracked the floor tiles of out anger! would not watch it again

HAHAHAHAHAHAHHAHAHHAHAHAHAHHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHHAHAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHHAAHAHAHAHHAAHHAHHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHHH really bad one of the worst movies i have seen.it even has it in the name just laughing its so bad.

Look if you are watching this for a good, well structured and well written movie with the proper character development and storyline then this ain't for you. I love that this movie exists. Sure almost no one will like it but for the few who like the nonsensical humor of animated shows and movie spoofs this was no let down. The humorous cameos were amazing and I appreciate what these directors continue to do. Obviously it's not gonna be a blockbuster hit but Why should it. Y'all gotta stop hating on a movie clearly not designed for your liking.
So awful I couldn't finish. Also, very gross.
Oof, that was rotten.

This film is a disgrace to cinema, and makes a complete mockery of anybody who has ever tried to make it in the film industry. Do not watch it, do not talk about it; it is awful in every possible way I can describe. There is nothing good about this film, it should be burned. It was created purely for profit, without a care for its artistic value (or lack thereof). It genuinely upsets me that Friedberg and Setzer have the ability to make relatively high budget films, but instead make this crap....and still make a profit? How this film was not a box office bomb will haunt my mind until I am in my grave. Just don't watch this, for your own good.
Disaster Movie is so embarrassingly bad. The only times I laughed were when I was laughing at the movie.
I love this movie it's silly and gross but I loved it as a kid and still do now I revisit it all the time
I haven't seen a lot of bad films yet, but as far as my knowledge goes, this is one of the worst, if not THE worst movie ever made. You can't have a comedy more juvenile and unpolished as this

I didn't know a movie could be this awful. I heard everyone on the internet talking about how crappy it was, and I was like "oh it can't be that bad!" I was wrong, I was sooo wrong. You see, before now, I had never seen a truly horrible film before. You think the Emoji Movie is bad? So did I, and after watching this movie I feel like I owe everyone behind the Emoji Movie a heartfelt apology. 

Almost every character in this movie accept one is either void of personality, or so irritating that I want to shoot myself. There are extended dance numbers and monologues that do absolutely nothing to further the story whatsoever. And when I say extended, I mean it. Most of the jokes and gags are abysmal I can only cherry pick a couple of times where I actually laughed. The only reason  I give this movie one star instead of half a star is that I was truly astonished at how awful it was.

Is this what they wanted? Were the people behind this movie so brilliant that they created the single worst movie anyone has ever laid their eyes upon only so that suckers like me can get worked up and flock to rottentomatoes.com to vent our frustrations. 

Have I been bamboozled? 

It's 3:30am I have to go.
Horrible! It ends with the hero being wed to his girlfriend by the love guru when they start singing they're dating every single movie and tv character this film has parodied.

Returning to their seemingly bottomless well of flatulence humor, racial stereotypes, and stale pop culture gags, Jason Friedburg and Aaron Seltzer have produced what is arguably their worst "Movie" yet.
Meh it was funny when I was a kid but it is stupid but yeah

This forgettable film holding The Flamin' Medallion Of True Terrible-Ness adds nothing new to its genre. In fact, by now, Friedburg and Seltzer have produced what is arguably their worst "Movie" yet. Characters: 0/5 Story: 0/5 Acting: 0/5 Special Effects: 0/5 Direction: 0/5 Cinematography: 0/5 Soundtrack: 0/5 Overall: 0/5
A pretty crappy movie with nothing of substance, a few good references and one pretty catchy funny song if you just like really crude humor. Look up the end for a short laugh, and ignore the rest.
Is it a good movie no, does it look fun to make? Yes, Why does this even exist Why didnt Seltzer and Friedberg do anything else

As terrible as Epic Movie is, Disaster Movie is even worse with it’s unbelievable special effects and worst parody humor!!!
it´s a boring experience

Generally when a movie aspires to be bad you can still get some laughs realizing the effort and silliness that went into making awful jokes - Screwed featuring Norm Macdonald and Dave Chapelle for example. This film is just incredibly lazy, embarrassing for everyone involved.

You should know what your getting into when you watch these series of parody's by now.  Obviously not everyone's taste but this one has some great moments like all of them and is a worthy addition to the group.

"I hated this movie. Hated hated hated hated hated this movie. Hated it. Hated every simpering stupid vacant audience-insulting moment of it. Hated the sensibility that thought anyone would like it. Hated the implied insult to the audience by its belief that anyone would be entertained by it." -Roger Ebert

I really hate this so much, this is the worst film I've seen
Burn all copies. Burn the original.
I'm not sure what the target demographic is for this movie, but I clearly wasn't anywhere near it.  This isn't even so bad that it is good (or entertaining), it is just plain bad.
Just aweful. This kind of "comedy" is just the worst. All it is, is pop culture references and toilet humor that is out of date upon relese.

This movie is abysmal in every sense of the word. Friedburg and Seltzer thinks that they are the kings of comedy when really, everyone (including me) wishes that they can go die a horrible death. Stay away from ANY of their movies if you wish to keep living a good life.

This movies pokes fun at clichés,celebrities, and movies in the worst way imaginable. This film can very rarely manage a chuckle through watchers and doesn't have the charm of the Scary Movies or Epic Movie. This combined with dated jokes and despite strong casting, it also has knockoff characters with no point of direction or just to add it for a bad joke. This film almost fails in every aspect in comedy wise and movie wise with added cringe, I suggest you avoid this movie at all costs or you will have a really bad movie time

I got a few cheap chuckles at some of the verbal jokes were so terrible. I was talking to myself a lot when watching this and getting frustrated but weirdly captivated and entertained at the same time. I think it was worse than what I thought it would be from word of mouth but It was more entertaining and less boring than I would've initially thought. Gross out humor was WAY too much though and made me very sick to my core.

Horrible.  I remember not liking it when the movie came out back in 2008, but since it was free to watch, I just tried again in 2020.  I couldn't make it even half way through.  I like some of the actors (Ike Barinholtz and Crista Flanagan, for example), but not even that could save the movie.  The acting by the "lead" male was bad, the gags weren't funny, the "plot" was vacuous, etc.
I gotta say Disaster Movie (2008) was pretty funny.
The fuck is this shit?
Nothing worse than a comedy that isn't funny. 100% of this movie is terrible toilet and reference humor.

A mess like this you may need a mop to clean this disaster of a movie. With comedy that is forced into your face that try’s to make you laugh but fails by a long-shot. The Only reason why I’m getting this one star instead of 0.5 stars because it only made me laugh once.
a horrible movie that made jokes about Amy Winehouse who was in a serious situation and didn't deserve it
More cancerous than The Emoji Movie!
The worst movie ever!

Ok I have to be honest here, why is this film regarded as one of the all time worst?

Do you people realize spoof movies are meant to be this stupid?

For what this is I really think it's a funny enough time waster also the ending song is awesome & catchy!

When people say that this movie lives up to its title...it's not a compliment. This movie somehow managed to be worse than the already painfully unfunny Epic Movie with Friedberg and Seltzer being back to doing what they do "best": just making fun of what's popular at the moment, passing off references to movies from the last two years as jokes, the only research being looking at trailers and production notes and having unfunny jokes go on forever for no other than to pad out the runtime. It doesn't help that the "plot" barely fits the criteria for a disaster movie spoof, whereas Epic Movie at least had Narnia as the main focus through and through. The few jokes that did made me laugh didn't having me fully giggling, so you still get the worst star rating a movie can get on this site. Remember when parody movies, including the Scary Movie series were actually professionally made? True, this ship has sailed but the most unrealistic thing about this movie is that SeltzerBerg still managed to make a few more parody films after this cheap ugly-looking mess.

If I was in middle school or just a lot dumber, maybe I would have liked "Disaster Movie." This movie is so bad that you really have to see it to believe it. The spoof genre has plenty of movies that are awful, but this one is easily one of the worst of the bunch. The references to things that were popular at the time are there, but the laughs are not. The movie features a ton of immature humor that made me smile here and there but I don't remember laughing even once because most of the movie is just plain bad. Every comedic moment that's awful in this movie goes on for way too long and it just started to make me uncomfortable. In the end, there are good spoof movies, there are bad ones, and there are ones like this movie that are downright unwatchable.
What a load of not-funny. Zzzzz

more than disaster movie you could call non-sense movie because the plot and making of the movie do not make sense. Overall it makes you laugh but only and only because it is full of useless quotes and not at all functional to the plot (which practically is not there) that serve only to amuse and most do not succeed
It sucks because it has a lot of parodies!
This movie isn't fun  it's just bad
One of the worst "comedies" ever shit out by a studio, Disaster Movie is the epitome on what NOT to do in a comedy.

This is a truly awful movie. Sadly it has a talented cast who've been let down by an awful script, that tries to add as many references to other films in as short a time as possible. This results in constant annoying interruptions to hide the lack of actual plot !!

I would recommend watching it though to see how NOT to make a movie !!
It stars Kim Kardashian. That's all I need to know.
A "movie" that offers zero laughs and relies on too many dated pop culture references for its humor. Disaster Movie offers nothing new and is quite possibly one of the worst movies ever made.

With overall quality being this bad, Friedberg and Seltzer should just stop making movies altogether. A dreadful spoof movie, that is much worse than their other failures. With it being so bombastically unfunny to some of the worst acting and storytelling imaginable. You wonder how much more of this you'll take before you wish you were blind and deaf. An abomination of cinema viewing, avoid it at all costs. Overall rating: 0.

to me this movie seems to be ok but It lacks I'm some parts this movie could have been better if they push the story and push it to the limit instead of having a story nearly makes no sense I feel this movie had a great idea just expand on it to make it better

Just like the movie's name, this movie falls short being a disaster. Also when the poster said our favorite movies will be destroyed, actually it's more like this movie destroyed itself by being stupid.
I love the chipmunks part, sorry
Funny and amusing; why hate on this when you can hate on worse movies?
Well there goes a 1.5 hours that I'll never get back! What a complete waste of time and money!

This movie is well... disastrous. Nothing else to say about it. Who thought this would be a good idea for a movie anyways? Obviously not me because I have better things to do anyways than watch this disaster movie.

I want to find the one critic on rotten tomatoes who gave this a "fresh review" because this film is utter shite from start to finish. The comedy in this film couldn't appeal to the lowest common dominator. the acting, what's the point of talking about the acting, it was like the actors just came on the set, didn't give a rats arse, just read there lines and then drunk their sorrows. Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer are scum of cinema, they honestly don't care about their craft and the audience and it shows with this atrocity of a film, it uses cheap humour, like Amy Winehouse being a drunk vampire. but the worse thing about this film is the ending, honestly I cant write into words how cheap the ending was. The thing that pisses me off the most is that the film mocks film which are 100 times better than this film, for example no country for old men which is a fantastic film by the Coen Brothers with unbelievable cinematography by the legend which is Roger Deakins. This is the worse film of all time, no film can be as bas as this, even if you tried you couldn't. This film gets 0/10.
I give if half because zero isn't an option this was actually one of the few movies in life I turned off half an hour in please don't bother

When I was 11, this was the funniest thing I'd ever seen (until I saw Scary Movie). It was probably one of the best films I'd ever seen.
Now at the age of 16, I watched it again and was able to recognize cliches etc and didn't find the film nearly as funny as I used to, laughing only in 2 or 3 spots. All in all, it's really quite a terrible film, and I don't think i'd ever watch it again, but still thanks to the creators for giving 11-year-old me tons of laughs.
These all deserved being universally panned

Not the best that Aaron Seltzer and Jason Friedberg have done, but it's not awful. The ending song in the unrated version is the best part. Don't get me wrong, I like Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer's movies, but I think they should have just stuck to being 2 of the 6 writers of Scary Movie.
One of the worst comedy's ever!
It's called Disaster Movie for a reason.
Good God Friedberg and Seltzer, just stop! Please!!!!
One of the worst movies of all time.

Disaster Movie sets a tone within about a minute in a half with burping gags, the awkward unfunniness never leaves the movie. Its a conveyor belt of gags based around a large roster of movies. Theres no consistency to the parodies and it suffers from hugely annoying characters which are of course, poorly acted. Its a pretty pointless and ghastly movie which gets boring very quickly. A massive low for the spoof genre.
This whole movies a disaster

Disaster movie at times it can be humorous, but writer/directors Aaron Seltzer, Jason Friedberg put so effort into trashing the film instead of writting it. It's boring but the only character that is funny is Nicole Parker's enchanted raunchy princess. When your movie has  Hannah Montana  crushed by a meteor and Juno is a spoff and unfunny your movie sucks!
Sure this movie can be stupid at times... Although it is very funny and uplifting. I don't know why people don't like this movie.

Score: 0/10
PROBABLY THE WORST FILM I'VE EVER SEEN. THERE IS NOT A SINGLE POSITIVE THING ABOUT IT.
I saw about 15 minutes of this mess. It was an awful.

I love disaster movie. There are so many good things to comment on, its hard to know where to start: the screenplay, plot, cast, acting, direction, editing, originality, cleverness, wittiness, intelligence, style, jokes, purpose, music, special effects, make-up and all-round funniness. This movie is perhaps the greatest ever achievement in film. There is nothing bad about this movie. Nothing. Its utterly flawless and deserves all the praise it gets. Seltzer and Friedberg have created their best film yet. Also, Ms. Kardashian is likely to win best actress given her stellar turn as lisa.

There are several funny moments in the movie.  However it is way to stupid, so stupid it seems so funny to laugh at how stupid it is.  Disaster Movie is a scattershot however, and chances are any random movie you pick will be better than this one.

I just watch it once, and that was enough.

no wonder why its called disaster movie becsuse its a disaster movie literaly . the acting , the story , the ability to live through the movie is dead .
the song at the end saves it from getting half a star

Easily the worst film I have ever seen that wasn't helmed by a female director. I am usually very picky when it comes to selecting movies to watch, hence my usually high satisfaction as a cinephile. I can't believe I wasted my time on this vile piece of garbage and that this ever saw a cinematic release when there MUST be thousands...NO, millions, of better things that could have been made instead. The Lumiere brothers must be rolling in their graves at how cinema has been travestied.

My only regret other than my time wasted and the scar on my brain from having watched it is the fact that unlike Metacritic, on Rotten Tomatoes I can't give it a zero rating. Or a negative, for that matter! =)

This comedy motion pictiure is boring, plotless, gross, and so painful to watch.
Really a DISASTER!
Hour and half wasted, indeed this is a disaster movie

Tragic. 
Some funny sketches but sketches do not make a movie.

One word to describe this movie? 
Awful!
Piece of crap horrid movie I couldn't finish this movie F
Like Niel Pond said "It's a merry, reckless mess, like a blender that gets revved up too high and spews everything out all over the countertops." I agree with him.
Friedberg and Seltzer have hit their lowest - it is essentially a terribly-made basket filled with every "don't" in the rules of comedy.

This is the worst spoof to ever be conceived. This is worse than Kate Gosling getting a show or worse than that... Having kids. 
This is worse than Justin Bieber.  Ok not that bad. 
It is amazing how far these two fell with this movie. The only redeeming factor to even get a half of a star is that there was one scene that I laughed at. It was the dumbest of all written, filmed and thought of of a scene but yet it was funny. The rest of the movie was a disaster. The rating if the film is the title. 
I will not waste anymore time or words on this.
I laughed in Disaster Movie. I´m one of the only humans on earth that laughed in this movie. I´m proud of myself.

Despite seeing the film, it doesn't even DESERVE a full star whatsoever. 
EVERY, SINGLE, THING wrong about this film is a clear indicator of what parody movies have wrong today.
If you liked this, then you would obviously love Plan 9 from Outer Space.
That's for sure.
The best part was the end credits.

I saw this movie once... sat all the way through it.  And, unsurprisingly, it is one of the worst comedies I have ever seen in my entire life.  I'm dead serious, there wasn't a single joke in this God-forsaken movie that worked!  The references were beyond obnoxious (especially the Juno parody), it looked incredibly cheap, and I find it rather sad that some of the actors had to play multiple characters.  Coming from a guy who is usually open minded when it comes to certain movies, even I have to scream at the hilltops to warn everyone: please, do not waste your money lining the pockets of Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer.  These two obviously are the murderers of comedy and never put any thought or effort in ANY of their films!  I am definitely doing my part by never seeing another film with their names attached to it!  Please avoid at all cost!
This movie is a hopeless mess
If only there was a way to give this movie no stars. This movie fails to be a spoof comedy. This movie is not spoofing anything it is just references from other movies.

(Sigh) There are times where I love the fact Uwe Boll and M. Night still have work and there are times where I am ecstatic they still have work. Because while they give me films, while often bad, they are at least entertainingly bad even if only a few scenes are. F and S give me nothing but insulting drivil, appealing only to the stupidest common dinominator and ONLY them.  This film isnt only there worst, it is the WORST, the absolute bottom beyond all bottoms, movie of ALL TIME. As a comedy, to quote the late great Roger Ebert, "this isn't the bottom of the barrel, this film doesn't belong in the same conversation as barrels". Braindead kids would probably hate this movies guts. Piss this movie off a damn mountain and never look back.
another guilty pleasure .
I didn't like this very much. It was after all, a movie after the amazing starving games, that's why I watched it, but this movie isn't so good. 2 stars cause some people actually liked it.
Disaster Movie is laughably, laughably bad, but at least it's laughable. It's such a colossal fail, and yet such a colossal success.
Takes the cake as the worst film of all time in my book.

Just an average spoof movie, nothing too special here at all. Didn't know Kim Kardashian was in it until it started and i have to say her acting is not good at all and her being in it just seemed to make the movie even cheesier because of her bad acting, this movie is just a rent at best in my opinion
In 5th grade, I thought it was hilarious.
0 stars, one of the worst movies I have seen.

As a huge fan of "so horrible it's funny" I had many things to appreciate in this film; Paris Hilton gets crushed, cheesy props, well-deserved mockery of those horrid CG Chipmunks movies to name a few.
it was pretty funny :)
Had its moments but like every time you go to the bathroom it's always just shit.

Failure, thy name is Disaster Movie! Sitting on the top of the mountain, this collection of fecal matter has no equal, and all that approach it are in awe of its repugnant stench. I want to burn myself with a can of hairspray and a lighter just to ease the pain.

The name says it all.  This movie is a disaster.  This is quite possibly the worst movie I have ever seen.  To make things worse, I went to see it in theaters.  There is almost nothing funny about this movie.  Its full of cheap laughs that aren't funny, racial stereotypes and just awful scenes.
Yea...... This was fucking horrible.
Had a lot of humor and hilarious stereotypes to make you burst out laughing. The point of the movie is to be cheesy and dumb, and you people don't see that. Just respect it for what it is.
Biggest pile of shit I have ever seen it's fucking terrible but it's so bad it it has a few laughs. It's a disgrace to the cinema world. FUCK
Three words, one feeling: WORST MOVIE EVER!!!!

Disaster movie starts with a shit joke, a joke about a movie where the reference wasn't relevant a year after its release, a crappy joke about a now dead celebrity, then a really long burp joke, then the main character wakes up from a dream, but you've only begun the nightmare. Yep, it's one of those movies. The first time I saw disaster movie I actually didn't think it was bad, but that was because I was roughly ten. Then I watched it again, and realized it was terrible. And with all the movies I've been reviewing, nothing has gone below a five, so I thought I'd just break a little history by reviewing my worst movie yet. That being said Disaster movie has tiny, tiny moments. It'll make you chuckle, but cringe from the stupidity shortly after. And I don't care if the second half was pure comedic gold, nothing can redeem the first thirty minutes of this movie. I don't know why these parody movies continue to only paradise good films, but it's even worse when the scale between those movies and this is so far. Every film in this movie, even the Love Guru and fucking High School Musical are better than this. And at least movies like Epic movie or the scary movies are mediocre to surprisingly good films, but this is just crap, and probably the worst parody movie I've ever seen. It's not just movies, which is another huge flaw. It's parodying dozens of celebrities, movies, to just stupid things in general. None of these things make you laugh like they should. It's not making points that the movies we like are bad under a certain light that is comedical, it's mostly poor shock value, and alongside painfully bad jokes. If you do laugh it'll be over something stupid and forgettable. Seeing a random Batman talk about how he spend the whole day on Amazon or Beowulf talking how he's not gay because he's business partners with his friend Paul in an antique shop. As far as the acting goes, I can't really say. It's like trying to examine a picture while it's covered in shit. The writing is so bad nobody could do it well, so how could I possibly critique what couldn't be done right? Yeah, it's bad, but the script I honestly believe could have been written better by a third grader. And another thing, this movie goes to random. By the second half your used to really immature style, and by then the movie is dead, but at least your used to it. But you could be watching a normal scene, then a character from a movie you may or may not have seen (there's so many movies, if your not a avid movie devotee, you won't understand a least a fifth of the dialogue) will pop up, say something stupid, will make you cringe, will then die by shock value, and as it fails the scene will move back. I imagine this movie probably was rushed, or something really bad happened, but seriously, this is inexcusable. With parody movies, they make fun of themselves, the movie, and in the end just take a serious scene and twist it into something to chuckle at. Some characters are meant to be exaggerated versions of the other characters, and some remain somewhat serious. With this, everyone is bat shit crazy, there's seemingly never ending poop jokes and people dying randomly and violently, and your just reminded of what better movies you could be watching. Not to mention main characters come and go at any moment, like they wanted more shock value deaths and stupidity added into it. If I had to say there was one good moment, it was the princess from enchanted. She actually parodied her character, and although did stupid shit, didn't annoy me, and made me chuckle at her voice and some lines that probably weren't even in the script. The most ironic thing is the title, it describes the whole movie. And I hate to use the word "stupid," in an argument, as it generally makes whoever said it look unintelligent themselves. But this movie is just blain stupid, no other way around it. The only people I could see liking it are kids, (hence the reason I liked it the first watch, but children shouldn't grow up with shitty movies like this, so don't let them watch this,) and the unintelligent. Not saying someone out there couldn't completely turn their brain off, let a bunch of dumb jokes go, and still find the movie kind of okay, but I don't think anyone can argue when taking the movie seriously that it is bad. Next to Vampires Suck, this is the worst of the worst. Parody movies I feel can be done well, if executed correctly. I could easily sit back and chuckle at some dumb lines from the scary movie series, or even Epic movie. If I reviewed those I'm sure they wouldn't rank up that bad, but those I feel had actual intelligence behind it, while also giving something for the immature kids who'll see the movie. This, nothing. Sure, you'll laugh at some parts, but cringe soon after. Laugh at the stupid stunt double being shown (cause that's not been done by every other parody movie) just know you'll probably be sighing in stupidity moments later. This is the logic of the movie. The guy wakes up with Flavor Flav who just banged his wife, he leaves, you find out she's stingy because apparently they broke up, then she asks him if he wants to take it to the next level. What? That's not funny, it wasn't even a joke, it's just there to be stupid! There I said the word stupid again, but this movie will make an entire audience idiots by just sucking you into this bullshit movie where a bunch of half naked chicks run on screen, one claims she shit herself, then run off screen. Anyway, huge thumbs down for this movie.

I found this truly disastrous and a real disappointment. Given the subject matter and the huge number of films out there, I expected a side-splitting movie packed full of hilarity. Instead, it was dull. The jokes were not funny and heavily over-laboured - instead of a quick joke and then on to the next, each one is dragged out to literally five minutes, killing off what little humour was originally there.

So much wasted potential. I don't know how I managed to watch it all - or more importantly, why I subjected myself to it!

This review is a shout out to all of you morons out there who give this movie positive feedback by saying, "Oh this movie is supposed to be ridiculous and silly, what do you expect?" It's one thing if you defend it by saying its funny because somehow that's your sense of humor, but to defend it by saying it's supposed to be stupid is what irritates me. This movie is NOT supposed to be stupid, ridiculous and silly. This movie is a parody movie, meaning that it's supposed to be funny, and words can't describe how unfunny it is. I saw some reviews that say, "If you saw this movie in the theater, expecting something other than something ridiculous, than you're going to hate it." Well, guess what? If I was expecting to see a stupid movie in the theaters, you know what I would do? NOT WASTE MY TIME WATCHING THE MOVIE. Everyone who saw this movie in the theaters expected something funny were disappointed by it, simply because it fails miserably at being funny and watchable because it's directed by the two worst directors in film history. I'm sick of people defending the movie this way, end of story.
so bad I never finished watching it.

Disaster Movie is, as they say on the internet, exactly what it says on the tin. The film is a massive collage of movies put together to try to create something funny; putting recognizable characters on screen and saying, "Look, there's [this character]. He/She has had a recent film which is relevant to today's youth and pop culture." The result fails.
 
Disaster Movie begins with the dream of the main character, Will, played by Matt "The Clone Wars" Lanter. In his dream, it is told that the world will end on August 29th, 2008 (ironically, the film's release date). 

During Will's Sweet Sixteen party, a bulletin comes out that it is indeed the end of the world. Now Will and his friend's Calvin, Juney (Juno), Lisa (played by Razzie nominated Kim Kardashian) and the Enchanted Princess (from Enchanted) have to fight their way through reference after reference to save Will's cheating ex-girlfriend Amy and possible save the world. Why he still cares for her is beyond me. 

The characters are way beyond dull, there are absolutely unmemorable. I can barely remember their names. The one characters who stands out would be the Enchanted Princess, who alternates between quirky, annoying, sometimes funny, badass and just plain weird. 

The script doesn't seem to care about the films its referencing. Not parodying, referencing. The storyline is only made in order to show these second-hand copies of popular movie characters. In fact, some of the films mentioned in the movie themselves aren't good or memorable. How can this film stand the test of time when it makes references that are outdated even six years later? The answer is it doesn't. 

The film also takes an almost mean-spirited ribbing of the movies and even celebrities. In other parody films, for example Young Frankenstein, the work being looked at and parodied is given the utmost respect upon the transfer to the screen. In films like this and even Airplane!, the comedy is almost all original and comes from witty dialog, background jokes and outlandish scenes. This film does none of that. Instead, it says, "Here's Batman. He's not acting like Batman. He has a pratfall. Laugh."

With all that said, this unfunny mess of the movie mash-up gets my vote for one of the worst movies of all time. All I can say is that the film makers of this film, who also released other films such as Date Movie, Epic Movie, Meet the Spartans and Vampires Suck, need to take a lesson out of the book of Mel Brooks. 

And for those out there who have just watched this, go watch Spaceballs. Not the greatest but you'll enjoy it a whole lot better. 

1/2 out of ****

(I should also note that the Princess does have the best line of the movie; "You know, they say that the first kill is supposed to be difficult. But I find it easy. In fact, rather fun." This line, to me, may be the only worth watching thing in the movie.)

When I discovered that Friedberg and Seltzer actually had the funds to make another 'Movie', I didn't know what this world was coming to. Their record before this film was not very good. The only film they've produced in the past that has shown glimpses of quality was Scary Movie which wasn't particularly great but had laughs in it. Other than that, they've produced some of the worst films I've ever had to experience. So, I had no expectations for this so-called film and rightly so. The gags are god awful, the jokes are god awful, everything associated with this film is god awful. I couldn't even smirk during this shit fest. This might just be one of the worst films I've ever seen and trust me I've some of the worst out there. What I'm pretty much saying is: avoid this horrible film! This is a real disaster. 0/5

I saw this in theatres when it came out and I still regret watching it to this day.

Same old Friedberg and Seltzer. Making poor excuses for parody movies. They're not even real parody movies, they're just a mish-mash of pointless, random pop culture references thrown at you for no apparent reason whatsoever. Same goes for the random product placements.

If I have to say one positive thing about this movie, it's that underneath the huge pile of completely random skecthes, lack of coherent plot, insultingly unfunny lines, burp jokes, midget cameos and bad impersonations, I thought I discerned some comedy talent in Crista Flanagan. But a terrible - utterly terrible - script made sure nothing funny came out of that film. And in addition: it feels weird when in the final scene a comedy song is ripped off, making it way less funny than the original. That's not a parody - that's a bad copy.
Never again will I ever see a movie made by these bozos (Seltzer & Friedberg).

'Disaster Movie' is exactly what the title says. There's not a single funny, original, or memorable joke in the entire film. There's no excuse for the greedy, self indulging, laziness that the filmmakers here have compiled. Let me take a few moments to name them.

If I ever find Jason Friedberg or Aaron Seltzer, the 'directors' of this so called film, I will kill them. So many good filmmakers are struggling to get on their feet and make their movies, and Friedberg and Seltzer are making trash and have no problem. They are also the writers of the so called 'movie' and are indeed members of the WGA. They should have their membership revoked for tainting the spirit and dignity of writers everywhere.

Of course, they also produced the film, and here's a list of other producers that I wag my finger at: Jerry P. Jacobs, Peter Safran, and Kenny Yates. Shame on you for going out and actually doing business with people in order to get the film made, edited, and distributed. Shame on you.

'Original' music by Christopher Lennertz, Cinematography by Shawn Maurer, Editing by Peck Prior, Casting by Tara Duncil, the list goes on and on and on, right to the payroll accountant.

But worst of all, the people who actually gave their money to these filmmakers, who do not actually have a credit in the film (I'm supposing they didn't want their name to be associated with it), whoever invested and executive produced this film, you are the lowest of scum. You are the epitome of bad taste, and indignity. I hope, for your sake, that I never meet you.

To the readers: Don't see this movie. Do NOT support this movie in any way, shape, or form. Do NOT give money to this movie. After all, they keep making more because people keep seeing them. On flixser, the percent of people who claimed they would not see the movie was 70%, the people who claimed they would see the movie was 30%. That 30% is too high. Please, stop bad filmmaking. It's the public's fault. Don't see the movie, I beg you.
